prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered on the white background. Coordinate System 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following Euler Angles: X=0.0, Y=0.0, Z=-90.0 and Translation Vector: X=0.0, Y=0.0862, Z=0.0. Sketch 1. Create a new face (face_1) and draw a loop on it. 2. Draw four lines for the loop: 1. line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0862, 0.0] 2. line_2: Start Point [0.0862, 0.0], End Point [0.0862, 0.75] 3. line_3: Start Point [0.0862, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] 4. line_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Extrusion 1. Scale the sketch by 0.75 in all directions. 2. Extrude the scaled sketch by a depth of 0.0862 towards the normal, and no extrusion in the opposite direction of the normal. 3. Apply the scaling parameter, sketch_scale, with a value of 0.75 for the final shape. 4. Since this is the first part in the assembly, there is no previous body to perform a boolean operation with. Part 2: Cylindrical Object Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic tube. Coordinate System 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following Euler Angles: X=-90.0, Y=0.0, Z=-90.0 and Translation Vector: X=0.0862, Y=0.0293, Z=0.0466. Sketch 1. Create a new face (face_1) and draw a loop on it. 2. Draw a circle with the specified properties: 1. Center: [0.0138, 0.0138] 2. Radius: 0.0138 Extrusion 1. No scaling or extrusion is necessary for the sketch. 2. Extrude the scaled sketch by a depth of 0.0 towards the normal, and by 0.0862 in the opposite direction of the normal. 3. Apply the scaling parameter, sketch_scale, with a value of 0.0276 for the final shape. 4. Perform a subtraction operation to remove the cylindrical object from the rectangular prism, since it is a tapered end.</description>
